verses.verse: Their heart is (1 Kin. 18:21; Zeph. 1:5; (Matt. 6:24)) divided; Now they are held guilty. He will break down their altars; He will ruin their sacred pillars.
For now they say, “We have no king, Because we did not fear the LORD. And as for a king, what would he do for us?”
They have spoken words, Swearing falsely in making a covenant. Thus judgment springs up (Deut. 31:16, 17; 2 Kin. 17:3, 4; Amos 5:7) like hemlock in the furrows of the field.

The inhabitants of Samaria fear Because of the (1 Kin. 12:28, 29; Hos. 8:5, 6; 13:2) calf of Beth Aven. For its people mourn for it, And its priests shriek for it— Because its (Hos. 9:11) glory has departed from it.
The idol also shall be carried to Assyria As a present for King (Hos. 5:13) Jareb. Ephraim shall receive shame, And Israel shall be ashamed of his own counsel.
As for Samaria, her king is cut off Like a twig on the water.

Also the (Hos. 4:15) high places of Aven, (Deut. 9:21; 1 Kin. 13:34) the sin of Israel, Shall be destroyed. The thorn and thistle shall grow on their altars; (Is. 2:19; Luke 23:30; Rev. 6:16) They shall say to the mountains, “Cover us!” And to the hills, “Fall on us!”
“O Israel, you have sinned from the days of (Hos. 9:9) Gibeah; There they stood. The (Judg. 20) battle in Gibeah against the children of iniquity Did not overtake them.
When it is My desire, I will chasten them. (Jer. 16:16) Peoples shall be gathered against them When I bind them for their two transgressions.

Ephraim is ((Jer. 50:11; Hos. 4:16; Mic. 4:13)) a trained heifer That loves to thresh grain; But I harnessed her fair neck, I will make Ephraim pull a plow. Judah shall plow; Jacob shall break his clods.”
Sow for yourselves righteousness; Reap in mercy; (Jer. 4:3) Break up your fallow ground, For it is time to seek the LORD, Till He (Hos. 6:3) comes and rains righteousness on you.
((Job 4:8; Prov. 22:8; Gal. 6:7, 8)) You have plowed wickedness; You have reaped iniquity. You have eaten the fruit of lies, Because you trusted in your own way, In the multitude of your mighty men.
